events.name: North Korea fires eight short-range ballistic missiles
events.wd_label: North Korea fires eight short-range ballistic missiles
events.wd_description: North Korea launched eight short-range ballistic missiles into the waters off its east coast, an unprecedented move according to the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff.
events.description: North Korea launched eight short-range ballistic missiles into the waters off its east coast, an unprecedented move according to the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff.

events.name: Missile launch details
events.wd_description: The missiles were launched from multiple sites between 9:08 a.m. and 9:43 a.m. Seoul local time, marking the third missile test since the new South Korean president took office.
events.description: The missiles were launched from multiple sites between 9:08 a.m. and 9:43 a.m. Seoul local time, marking the third missile test since the new South Korean president took office.

events.name: Japanese response
events.wd_description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida protested the launch, citing it as a violation of UN resolutions.
events.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida protested the launch, citing it as a violation of UN resolutions.

events.name: Missile specifications
events.wd_description: Japan's Defense Ministry reported that six of the missiles reached a maximum altitude of 50 to 100 kilometers and traveled a distance of 300 to 400 kilometers.
events.description: Japan's Defense Ministry reported that six of the missiles reached a maximum altitude of 50 to 100 kilometers and traveled a distance of 300 to 400 kilometers.

events.name: Defense response
events.wd_description: South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Won In-Choul and Commander of the ROK-US Combined Forces Command Paul LaCamera held a virtual meeting to reaffirm their defense capability to detect and intercept North Korean missiles.
events.description: South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Won In-Choul and Commander of the ROK-US Combined Forces Command Paul LaCamera held a virtual meeting to reaffirm their defense capability to detect and intercept North Korean missiles.

events.name: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_label: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.
events.description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.

events.name: Putin's statement
events.wd_description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.
events.description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.

events.name: Russia's previous warnings
events.wd_description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.
events.description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.

events.name: Finland and Sweden's NATO bid
events.wd_description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.
events.description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.

events.name: North Korean ballistic missile launch
events.wd_description: North Korea launched a ballistic missile from the Sunan airport, aiming to achieve nuclear arsenal dominance as fast as possible.
events.description: North Korea launched a ballistic missile from the Sunan airport, aiming to achieve nuclear arsenal dominance as fast as possible.

events.name: Missile launch
events.wd_description: The missile was traced to the ocean of North Korea’s east coast, confirmed by the Japanese Ministry of Defence.
events.description: The missile was traced to the ocean of North Korea’s east coast, confirmed by the Japanese Ministry of Defence.

events.name: Regional response
events.wd_description: South Korea and Japan attested to the launch, with South Korea's President Yoon Suk-yeol promising a strong military alliance with the United States.
events.description: South Korea and Japan attested to the launch, with South Korea's President Yoon Suk-yeol promising a strong military alliance with the United States.

events.name: Automakers investing in battery production
events.wd_description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.
events.description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.

events.name: Ford and General Motors
events.wd_description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.
events.description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.

events.name: Hyundai's investment
events.wd_description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.
events.description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.

events.name: Stellantis and Samsung's plan
events.wd_description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.
events.description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.

events.name: Current reliance on China
events.wd_description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.
events.description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.

events.name: Increasing control over supply chains
events.wd_description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.
events.description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.

events.name: Federal investment
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.
events.description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.

events.name: Transition to EVs
events.wd_description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.
events.description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.

events.name: Challenges in building supply chains
events.wd_description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.
events.description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.

events.name: Timeframe for building mines
events.wd_description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
events.description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
